content:
Diagnosis:	Metastatic prostate adenocarcinoma with mixed small cell features

Management:	2023-10 Started enzalutamide
		2024-01 Commenced PRESTO trial arm B (cabazitaxel + experimental agent)

Histology:	Mixed adenocarcinoma with small cell transformation on repeat biopsy
		FANCI mutation detected on molecular panel

Current Situation:	Cycle 4 PRESTO trial

I reviewed [redacted name] today for his trial assessment. His disease-related symptoms have unfortunately worsened over the last 3 weeks with increasing bone pain affecting the thoracic spine and left hip. His mobility has declined and he now requires two walking sticks. Performance status has deteriorated to ECOG 2. He reports grade 2 peripheral neuropathy affecting his feet, which developed after cycle 3.

Latest PSA has risen from 234 to 289. CT scan performed on 15/4/24 shows mixed response with reduction in some bone lesions but new vertebral metastases at T8 and T10. Trial blood samples were collected as per protocol.

Given the deteriorating clinical picture and rising PSA, I have discussed with the trial team and we have agreed to discontinue trial treatment. He will be referred for palliative radiotherapy to symptomatic bone sites and consideration of standard second-line chemotherapy with docetaxel once his neuropathy improves.

I have arranged urgent MRI spine to exclude cord compression and referred to the palliative care team. Will review in 2 weeks with repeat PSA and post-radiotherapy.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: Mixed adenocarcinoma with small cell transformation
primary_cancer.metastases: bone metastases including T8 and T10 vertebrae

cancer_timeline.value: Commenced PRESTO trial arm B (cabazitaxel + experimental agent)
CT shows mixed response with reduction in some bone lesions but new vertebral metastases at T8 and T10
Discontinued from PRESTO trial due to disease progression

patient_facts.value: Increasing bone pain affecting thoracic spine and left hip
Requires two walking sticks for mobility
CT 15/04/24 shows mixed response with new vertebral metastases

status_updates.value: Metastatic prostate cancer with mixed small cell features showing disease progression on PRESTO trial. Clinical deterioration with worsening bone pain and rising PSA.
Disease progression with rising PSA and new vertebral metastases despite trial treatment
Grade 2 peripheral neuropathy developed after cycle 3 of trial treatment
Discontinued from PRESTO trial due to disease progression
Deterioration in mobility requiring two walking sticks, PS declined to ECOG 2
Urgent MRI spine to exclude cord compression, repeat PSA in 2 weeks
Referred for palliative radiotherapy and palliative care team review, clinic review in 2 weeks
